title: Title game confidential: Scouts and coaches break down Miami-Indiana
content: Who holds the talent edge? What will decide the national championship? More than two dozen coaches, scouts and front office members weigh in to Pete Thamel.

title: Sources: Fins hiring Packers' Hafley as new HC
content: The Dolphins are hiring Green Bay Packers defensive coordinator Jeff Hafley to become their next head coach, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Bills fire McDermott; Beane promoted to president
content: The Bills fired coach Sean McDermott and promoted Brandon Beane to president after Buffalo again failed to reach the Super Bowl despite its regular-season success.

title: Seahawks lose RB Charbonnet for rest of playoffs
content: Seahawks running back Zach Charbonnet will need season-ending surgery after suffering a significant knee injury Saturday, coach Mike Macdonald said Monday.

title: King James aversion: LeBron not an ASG starter
content: For the first time in over two decades, LeBron James has not been voted an All-Star starter. A trio of former MVPs join Luka Doncic and Victor Wembanyama for the West. The East sports three first-time starters along with Giannis and Jalen Brunson.

title: Arizona unanimous No. 1 for first time; ISU falls
content: Arizona is the unanimous No. 1 for the first time in program history, retaining the top spot for a sixth straight week. UConn, Michigan, Purdue and Duke round out the top five.

title: Lions set to hire Petzing as new OC, sources say
content: The Lions are finalizing a deal to hire former Cardinals offensive coordinator Drew Petzing as their next offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Broncos open window for Dobbins' return
content: The Broncos are opening the window for RB J.K. Dobbins to return to practice this week and potentially play in the AFC Championship Game, sources told ESPN.

title: Bears' Williams: Wasn't on same page with Moore
content: Bears quarterback Caleb Williams stressed the importance of being on the same page with his wide receivers after DJ Moore faced criticism for his route-running effort in overtime.

title: ✍ NBA midseason grades for all 30 teams
content: Kevin Pelton gives a grade for all 30 teams halfway through the season. Which teams exceeded expectations?

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: 'Everyone has someone to cheer for': Inside Fernando Mendoza's Miami homecoming
content: Indiana's quarterback has deep roots in South Florida, creating some split loyalties for the title game.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: The 2026 NBA All-Star starters are set. Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks? Concern about Stafford?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? Matthew Stafford is in a funk? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona solidifies spot, Kansas returns
content: The latest top-25 poll is out, featuring all three unbeaten teams. What's next for all 25 ranked teams?

title: Los Angeles prevails in divisional round win over Chicago
content: The Bears had been kings of comeback wins, but the Rams are the ones advancing to the NFC title game.

title: Sizing up the AL Central: What each team still needs to do before spring training
content: There haven't been a lot of headline deals in this division so far, but there's still work left this winter.

title: Man United stun rivals City; Senegal win AFCON amid controversy; Barcelona lose; more
content: What a weekend! Man United stunned their rivals City in a fiery derby, Senegal won AFCON amid controversial scenes, Thomas Frank is on the brink as Spurs boss and Barcelona somehow lost at Real Sociedad.

title: Chaotic AFCON final an embarrassment to soccer
content: Fan clashes, VAR controversies, missed penalties, a walkout, Senegal's extra time winner - the AFCON final had it all.

title: Will Colts, Daniel Jones run it back in 2026?
content: There's mutual interest, but there's also the matter of the QB's recovery from a December torn Achilles.

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: Leo Carlsson, Brayden Point and Seth Jones are among those ailing ahead of Milan Cortina. Plus, what to watch in the NHL this week.

title: 'Small details make the difference': How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: At the 2025 US Open, Sinner was soundly beaten by Alcaraz. Since then, the two-time Australian Open champ has made adjustments.

title: Meet 'the special 13': The JMU transfers forming an unlikely Indiana CFP title core
content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: Indiana could go 16-0 with a title game win -- but it wouldn't be the first. Meet 1894 Yale
content: Indiana could complete a 16-0 season with a national championship win over Miami on Monday night. But it won't be the first team to accomplish the feat.

title: Denver advances, but Bo Nix is out: Six questions about where the Broncos go from here
content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea open to Fernández exit; Madrid, PSG interested
content: Chelsea's Enzo Fernández could be available this summer as Real Madrid and PSG monitor his situation. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail UFC championship predictions in 2026.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: 5 reasons why Cong should dump DMK, join TVK
content: As Tamil Nadu Congress strategizes for the 2026 elections, it's at a crossroads: should it maintain its long-standing alliance with the DMK or consider a fresh partnership with the charismatic actor Vijay's TVK? Tensions within the party flared after the DMK turned down a proposed power-sharing deal, leading to lessons on 'coalition dharma'.

title: Boost for defence exports as Rajnath flags off 1st batch of Pinaka guided rockets for Armenia
content: India has achieved a significant milestone in defense exports by flagging off the first batch of guided Pinaka rocket systems for Armenia. This move underscores India's growing prowess as a reliable supplier of advanced defense technology, transitioning from an importer to a major exporter. The Pinaka system, known for its accuracy and range, highlights the nation's burgeoning defense industry.

title: Flight duty norms: DGCA exemptions end on Feb 10, IndiGo may cut more flights
content: IndiGo may reduce flights after February 10 as a DGCA exemption for new flight-duty rules expires. The airline plans a "short-term network readjustment," potentially shifting some A320 routes to ATR aircraft to avoid major disruptions. Affected passengers will be informed and offered refunds or alternative flights.

title: List WB voters with ‘logical discrepancy’: SC to poll panel
content: The Supreme Court has ordered the Election Commission to display lists of West Bengal voters facing "logical discrepancy" notices in panchayat and block offices, granting them an additional 10 days to submit proof of credentials. The court also directed the state to provide manpower and ensure law and order for the special intensive revision drive.

title: EAM to Poland: Stop fuelling terror infra
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar urged Poland to adopt a zero-tolerance stance on terrorism, advising against supporting terrorist infrastructure in India's vicinity. He also voiced India's displeasure over what he termed "selective targeting" by European nations regarding the Russia-Ukraine war and trade relations with Russia, deeming it unfair and unjustified.

title: 'This is not a disaster': Palmer Luckey writes a long note on Meta layoffs; was fired by Zuckerberg
content: Oculus founder Palmer Luckey believes Meta's recent layoffs at Reality Labs, while unfortunate for employees, are a positive step for the VR industry. He argues that cutting first-party content development, which heavily competed with third-party studios, will foster a healthier ecosystem and allow independent developers to thrive.

title: India, UAE to elevate ties with strategic defence partnership
content: India and UAE solidified their strategic defense partnership with a new letter of intent, alongside agreements on space collaboration and LNG purchase. The visit also saw commitments to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032 and explore significant infrastructure development in Gujarat.

title: India on cusp of upper-middle income status: Per capita income to rise; economy set to be 3rd largest
content: India’s climb up the income ladder was slow for decades, taking 60 years to move from low income to lower-middle income. Since then, growth has sharply accelerated, and a likely transition into the upper-middle-income category by around 2030.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
content: MacKenzie Scott, ex-wife of Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: Italian designer Valentino Garavani dies at 93; a look back at his career
content: Legendary Italian fashion designer Valentino Garavani, renowned for defining modern couture and dressing global icons, has died at 93. He founded the Valentino fashion house in 1959, becoming synonymous with high glamour and shaping Italian fashion for over five decades. His legacy includes iconic designs and building a global luxury empire.

title: 'I can't do it anymore': Saina Nehwal, 35, announces retirement
content: India’s badminton star Saina Nehwal has confirmed her retirement, revealing a chronic knee condition and arthritis left her unable to meet elite demands. The 2012 Olympic bronze medallist last played in 2023 and said she stepped away quietly on her own terms. Persistent knee degeneration, worsened since a Rio 2016 injury, ultimately ended her career.

title: Pakistan's Raja embarrasses himself in front of Bangladesh crowd - watch
content: Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja faced an awkward moment during the toss of a BPL 2025–26 match when his call to “make some noise” was met with near silence. The clip went viral on social media, drawing mixed reactions. While some mocked the moment, others defended Raja, citing poor acoustics or early crowd turnout. Raja quickly moved on and continues as a prominent voice in the league.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: A 'golden' bid for dominance: Decoding Trump's Greenland grab; knock-out blow for Russia, China?
content: Donald Trump's renewed focus on Greenland, linked to his 'Golden Dome' missile defence proposal, signals a strategic shift.  This Arctic island is seen as vital for US national security, offering a crucial vantage point against Russia and China.  The ambitious 'Golden Dome' aims for near-invulnerability, sparking global concerns over strategic stability and the militarisation of space.

title: Yunus defends minority-violence in Bangladesh, says only 71 of 645 incidents 'communal'
content: Bangladesh's interim government claims most 2025 incidents involving minorities were criminal, not communal. Out of 645 cases, only 71 had religious motives, including temple vandalism and threats. The government emphasizes accurate classification to combat misinformation, but minority groups question the assessment, fearing it emboldens criminals.

title: Is Jalen Brunson playing Tonight vs Mavericks? Knicks injury update
content: Jalen Brunson is questionable for the New York Knicks' January 19, 2026 home game against his former team, the Dallas Mavericks, due to a right ankle sprain. His absence has impacted the Knicks' offense and their ability to stop a three-game losing streak. The team's competitiveness hinges on his availability, especially with Dallas also dealing with multiple injuries.

title: 'Played very soft cricket': Ashwin pulls no punches after India lose ODI series vs NZ
content: Ravichandran Ashwin expressed disappointment following India's maiden ODI series loss to New Zealand at home, deeming the team's response "a bit flat." He felt the visitors, despite missing key players, effectively dominated the series. Ashwin highlighted India's lack of pressure on New Zealand and described their play as "very soft cricket."

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
content: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Matthew Stafford’s wife, daughters wow Chicago in matching Rams outfits
content: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: Madhu Chopra says Siddharth became collateral to Priyanka’s success
content: Priyanka Chopra's mother, Madhu Chopra, revealed that her son Siddharth suffered due to Priyanka's early stardom. Madhu's extensive travel to support Priyanka's career meant Siddharth often grew up without significant parental presence. She expressed regret over this, acknowledging him as 'collateral damage' to her daughter's success.

title: All for one: When entire SA team was awarded 'Player of the Match' in a Test
content: South Africa comprehensively dominated the West Indies in the 1998-99 Test series, securing a 5-0 whitewash. The final Test saw South Africa win by 351 runs, leading to the entire Proteas team being named Player of the Match in a rare decision.

title: Oskar Sundqvist injury update after skate cut vs Connor McDavid
content: Blues forward Oskar Sundqvist suffered a deep skate cut above his ankle after a collision with Connor McDavid. While head coach Jim Montgomery confirmed the injury did not touch his Achilles, the severity of the cut leaves his return timeline uncertain. Sundqvist is listed as day-to-day, impacting the Blues' forward depth.

title: Akshay Kumar escort car accident in Mumbai, no casualties reported
content: An escort vehicle from Akshay Kumar’s convoy was involved in a serious road accident in Mumbai on Monday evening after it reportedly collided with an auto-rickshaw near the actor’s residence in Juhu. According to preliminary reports, at least two people sustained injuries in the incident. Akshay Kumar was not present in the escort car at the time of the accident.

title: Type 075 ship: The ace up Xi's sleeve? All about China's trump card for Taiwan takeover
content: China’s Type 075 amphibious assault ships have become a prominent symbol of Beijing’s rising military pressure on Taiwan. Their deployment in large-scale drills encircling the island in December highlighted their importance to any future cross-strait operation. Combining helicopter operations, landing craft and troop deployment, the vessels significantly enhance China’s amphibious and power-projection capabilities, reshaping the regional security balance.

title: 'Deceived, not enemy soldiers': Amnesty window open for youth in Iran 'riots'
content: Protests erupted across Iran in late December over economic hardship, escalating into anti-regime unrest. Authorities report thousands of deaths, widespread arrests, and violent clashes, particularly in Kurdish regions. Supreme Leader Khamenei vowed harsh punishment, blaming foreign interference. Police offered leniency to “deceived” protesters. While cities show signs of calm and limited internet restoration, tensions and restrictions persist amid continuing government crackdowns.

title: Larsa Pippen shuts down LiAngelo Ball dating rumors, ends gossip
content: Larsa Pippen has vehemently denied a viral deepfake rumor linking her to rapper LiAngelo Ball.  The AI-generated image, which depicted an intimate pose, caused a stir online. Pippen, currently dating basketball star Jeff Coby, urged fans to cease creating such fabricated content, emphasizing the distress it causes. She clarified her relationship status, putting an end to the baseless speculation.

title: Bill Belichick joins ESPN as UNC looks ahead after disappointing 4–8 season
content: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.

title: T20 WC: Scotland to replace Bangladesh? Fresh updates emerge
content: Scottish cricket officials have said the ICC has not contacted them about replacing Bangladesh at the T20 World Cup, despite speculation. Scotland, the highest-ranked team outside the tournament, would be ready if approached but are not initiating talks out of respect for Bangladesh, whose participation remains uncertain amid venue and political concerns.

title: Jaishankar hits out at ‘selectively targeted’ Russian oil tariffs - what he told Polish FM
content: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar held extensive talks with Poland's Deputy Prime Minister Radosław Sikorski, reviewing bilateral cooperation in economy, technology, and defense. Discussions also covered global and regional developments, with both nations emphasizing the need to counter terrorism and selective targeting in trade.

title: Who leads the world in maths? Asia tops, America stumbles and India doesn’t show up
content: Asia’s grip on global mathematics is no longer about topping ranks, but about how far ahead it stands. As East Asian systems pull away, the United States struggles to lift its middle, slipping below the OECD average. India, despite its scale and reputation, remains absent altogether, not because of failure, but because it chose not to be measured.

title: India-EU FTA: How 'mother of all trade deals' can offset Trump's tariff - explained
content: India-EU FTA: India and the EU are on the verge of sealing a landmark trade deal, marking India’s ninth trade pact in four years as both sides accelerate deal-making amid rising global protectionism. The agreement promises market access gains for Indian goods and services.

title: '10-minute delivery' era ends: gig workers relieved; safety concerns outweigh speed
content: In a notable shift, India's rapid delivery services are stepping away from their ambitious '10-minute delivery' goals, influenced by both government regulations and labor advocate movements. This decision places a heavier emphasis on the safety of delivery personnel, a change that many workers and customers are applauding.

title: Orange is the new Red: Is Trump America's most Left-leaning president?
content: Critics often call him a right-wing white supremacist nationalist and, much like the Holy Roman Empire, none of those descriptors are remotely accurate. He’s not right-wing, not a white supremacist, and not even nationalist. Trump doesn’t care about race at all, not in the way people think. He’s barely nationalist and will always put his own self-interest ahead of the nation’s. And right-wing? He’s the most left-leaning POTUS, so much so that if McCarthy were around today, he would blacklist him.

title: Ind vs NZ: Can Nitish Reddy be Hardik Pandya's backup? Former cricketer gives verdict
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes Nitish Kumar Reddy should have featured earlier in the ODI series against New Zealand. Pathan highlighted Reddy's promising batting and bowling performances, suggesting he could be a valuable backup for Hardik Pandya. The youngster's potential to play big shots and bowl at decent speeds impressed Pathan, who advocates for continued management support.

title: The squeeze play: How BJP is shrinking space for regional parties - decoded
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is strategically shrinking the political space for regional parties across India. Recent election results in Maharashtra, Bihar, and Uttar Pradesh demonstrate the BJP's success in weakening rivals through fragmentation, welfare schemes, and narrative control. While regional parties persist, their ability to translate state power into national influence has significantly diminished.

title: Broncos vs Patriots injury report: Latest on Dobbins, Nix and more
content: The AFC Championship Game between the Denver Broncos and New England Patriots is clouded by significant injuries. Broncos QB Bo Nix is out for the season with an ankle fracture, while RB J.K. Dobbins' return is uncertain. The Patriots are also monitoring CB Carlton Davis's concussion status, with these key player absences potentially deciding the Super Bowl berth.

title: Nitin Nabin elected BJP chief unopposed: To take charge tomorrow; PM Modi to attend event
content: Nitin Nabin has been elected unopposed as the national president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, set to formally take charge on January 20. His uncontested election, at 45 years old, signifies a generational leadership shift within the party. The smooth transition highlights the BJP's internal consensus and procedural discipline ahead of future elections.

title: 'Double agent of Israel': Josh Shapiro drops bombshell about Kamala Harris
content: Shapiro writes that he pushed back immediately, calling the question offensive and absurd. What troubled him more than the question itself was what it suggested about the assumptions being made. He wondered whether similar scrutiny was being applied to non-Jewish contenders, or whether he was being treated as a unique risk because of his identity and his outspoken criticism of antisemitism on US college campuses after the October 7 attacks.

title: Cracks appear in Punjab Congress over calls for Dalit representation in party by Channi
content: Channi asserted he did not speak against any particular caste or community, and that he was a victim of malicious propaganda on social media

title: BJD demands Odisha Mines Minister’s removal after ED raids on his representative
content: State Steel and Mines Minister Bibhuti Bhushan Jena had designated Sunil Patra as his representative for mines department and representative’s active involvement in illegal mining came to the fore during ED’s raid, alleged the regional party

title: Odisha’s saltwater crocodile population rises to 1,858
content: As a future strategy, drones and cameras will be used in selected river segments to identify and profile individual crocodiles based on distinctive morphological features, said P. K. Jha, PCCF (Wildlife)

title: SC seeks govt response on plea for quota, concessional fare for acid attack survivors on trains
content: Due to the nature of their burn injuries, persistent itching, especially after undergoing surgery, acid attack survivors often need to travel by train in air-conditioned coaches.

title: Delhi HC quashes 2016 income tax notices to Prannoy Roy, Radhika Roy
content: Bench terms the reassessment proceedings "arbitrary" and against fundamental and constitutional rights

title: No new Guillain Barre Syndrome case in two days in M.P.’s Neemuch; six still in hospital
content: The outbreak had been reported in Neemuch’s Manasa town when child and a teenager died on January 11 and January 13 respectively. 18 people have so far reported to have been infected.

title: First guava processing plant in Rajasthan to improve farmers’ livelihood with value addition
content: The promotion of agricultural and horticultural products would help enhance the farmers’ income and strengthen the rural economy, said Om Birla

title: Haryana govt.’s changes to monthly aid scheme leave women ‘falling through the cracks’
content: The Haryana government has amended the scheme through a notification on January 8 to make the payment in two parts from the second month onwards

title: Nitish begins Samriddhi Yatra to review 430 projects announced before election
content: During his yatra, Nitish Kumar said that he will increase the financial assistance given to women, especially to Jeevika didis

title: The youth, women, poor, farmers are the foundational pillars of India: V.K. Saraswat, NITI Ayog member
content: ‘The choices you [students] make now will determine whether India’s rise is transactional or transformational’

title: SC questions Delhi government over ‘hurried’ rollout of new law regulating private school fees
content: Implementing the legislation midway through an ongoing academic session could lead to significant practical and financial difficulties for schools, the Bench says

title: Civil engineer arrested for cheating techie of ₹1.53 crore on the pretext of marriage
content: The fraud came to light when the woman visited the accused’s house and discovered that he was married and had a child

title: Diplomatic spat between India and Poland as Foreign Ministers spar over Pakistan and Russia
content: Jaishankar says Poland shouldn’t help ‘fuel’ terrorism in the region, refers to EU oil sanctions as ‘selective targeting’;  Radoslaw Sikorski describes India’s participation in Zapad exercises in Russia as ‘threatening’

title: 14 school children injured as swing collapses in Madhya Pradesh’s Jhabua
content: All the injured are being treated at the district hospital and a magisterial investigation committee has been formed, says district collector; 2 girls are seriously injured and recovering; in viral video, the swing can be seen suddenly collapsing along with the large metal frame it was hanging on

title: Trinamool and BJP clashover Form 7 submission
content: A delegation of West Bengal BJP met the Chief Electoral Officer and called for the deadline for submission of Form 7 to be extended by at least a week

title: Back-to-back arrests of sexual offenders in Kochi city raise safety concerns
content: While two each were nabbed by the Ernakulam North police and the Ernakulam Central police, the fifth person was arrested by the Maradu police

title: Solar energy cuts grid power consumption by about 46% in government schools, says study
content: The report was prepared in collaboration with the Indian Institute for Human Settlements. The State government’s  ‘Green Schools’ initiative has been expanded to 300 government schools across multiple phases, covering almost all districts

title: Responsibilities to be assigned to ex-Agniveers yet to be decided: CISF D-G
content: The officer said they were awaiting instructions from the Union Home Ministry on the reservation percentage for Agniveers in the CISF and also on the pattern of reservation to be followed, whether horizontal or vertical.

title: UAE Signs $2.5 Billion Gas Deal With Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd
content: The UAE announced on Monday a new liquified natural gas (LNG) deal with a state-run Indian company valued at more than $2.5 billion dollars.

title: Poland Seeks New Trade Partners, Says India Has Shown Willingness To Engage
content: Polish Deputy PM and Minister of Foreign Affairs Radoslaw Sikorski, outlining the importance of his visit to India, said Poland has faced "increased tariffs" and is seeking new trade partners, emphasising the need to create a free trade environment.

title: Kerala Man Dies By Suicide Over Social Media Post, Case Filed Against Woman
content: Police here on Monday registered a case against a woman in connection with the suicide of a 42-year-old man after she allegedly posted a video on social media accusing him of sexual harassment during a bus journey, officials said.

title: UP Labourer Receives Rs 7 Crore Income Tax Notice
content: A daily-wage labourer in an Uttar Pradesh village claimed to have received an I-T department notice demanding over Rs 7 crore in unpaid taxes. He is predictably puzzled and distressed about how to respond.

title: Diplomacy Or Retaliation? EU's Options Amid Tensions With US Over Greenland
content: Threats from the White House over Greenland have sparked outrage and a flurry of diplomatic activity across Europe, as leaders consider possible countermeasures, including retaliatory tariffs.

title: Sikkim Man Arrested In Rs 13,000 Crore International Drug Trafficking Case
content: The Special Cell of the Delhi Police has arrested a key accused from Sikkim in connection with a massive Rs 13,000 crore international narcotics smuggling case linked to the seizure of a massive consignment of cocaine, mephedrone and Thai marijuana,

title: 71 of 645 Bangladesh Minority Incidents in 2025 Were Communal: Yunus
content: Bangladesh interim government's Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus on Monday said that police records from January to December 2025 documented 645 incidents involving minorities.

title: Sabarimala Gold Heist Appears To Be Planned Plunder: Kerala High Court
content: The Kerala High Court on Monday made scathing observations in the Sabarimala gold theft case, strongly reinforcing suspicions that the gold plates at Lord Ayyappa's sanctum were systematically removed as part of a planned plunder of Devaswom assets.

title: NRI Woman Wins Appeal For Workplace Fairness Over Chronic Illness In UK
content: An NRI professional on Monday won her High Court appeal in London after a six-year battle for workplace fairness for women suffering from a chronic illness.

title: Big Action In Techie Drowning Case: Top Noida Official Removed, SIT Formed
content: Following the death of a 27-year-old software engineer whose car plunged into a water-filled pit at a construction site in Noida's Sector 150, the Noida Authority CEO M Lokesh has been removed from his post.

title: Authorities Alarmed By Mysterious "Boiling" Seawater Off Gujarat Coast
content: Authorities and the fishing community are alarmed by reports of churning and bubbling of seawater off the Gujarat coast, an official in Palghar district said on Monday.

title: UAE President's 3-Hour India Visit And PM Modi's Special Gesture
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today welcomed the UAE's President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan in Delhi and shared visuals of the gesture, where both leaders were seen hugging.

title: Hackers Target Iran's State TV To Air Footage Supporting Exiled Crown Prince
content: Hackers disrupted Iranian state television satellite transmissions to air footage supporting the country's exiled crown prince and calling on security forces to not "point your weapons at the people," footage online showed early Monday.

title: 3 Arrested In Chennai For Attempted Murder Of Delivery Worker
content: Three men have been arrested in Chennai in connection with the attempted murder of a 23-year-old delivery worker who was stabbed multiple times in the Velachery area on Sunday, triggering a political exchange over law and order in Tamil Nadu.

title: Ahmedabad's Fake Doctors And 'Black Blood' Scam Busted By Alert Banker
content: In a chilling tale of deception, the Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Branch intercepted a sophisticated gang targeting the city's most vulnerable: senior citizens living with chronic pain.

title: Prince Harry, Elton John "Violated" By UK Media's Alleged Intrusion
content: Alleged unlawful information gathering by two UK newspapers made Prince Harry "paranoid beyond belief" and left Elton John feeling "violated", the pair have testified as a joint lawsuit opened Monday in the High Court.

title: "What's Happening In Greenland, Gaza, Venezuela Beyond Parody": William Dalrymple
content: William Dalrymple, host of the globally acclaimed podcast "Empire: World History" - which currently boasts over a million monthly downloads - is a man who views the chaos of the present through the long, often bloody lens of the past.

title: Claims, Objections Deadline For Tamil Nadu SIR Extended Till January 30
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has extended the deadline for filing claims and objections related to the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Tamil Nadu till January 30, 2026.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Showcases Maharashtras $1 Trillion Roadmap At Davos 2026
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said Maharashtra has emerged as India's gateway for foreign investment and will keep on attracting large investments across regions and sectors.

title: Karnataka Considering Holding Local All Body Polls At One Go: DK Shivakumar
content: The Karnataka government has said it is considering conducting all local body elections, including the civic polls in Bengaluru, at one go.

title: Panel launches campaign to empower women
content: Parannuyaraam Karuthode’ is a year-long Statewide campaign that aims at equipping women to navigate life’s crises with mental fortitude

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session to begin on January 20 with Governor’s address
content: Over the past three years, issues surrounding Governor R.N. Ravi’s address and his walkouts from the House have emerged as one of the major points of contention between Raj Bhavan (now Lok Bhavan) and the State government

title: Vadhavan port is a threat to the environment and livelihood of Palghar’s people: protesters
content: The Vadhavan port needs to be stopped because it will destroy the livelihood of people in Palghar, especially fisherfolk, the Kisan Sabha said

title: Airfare surges during festivals ‘exploitative’, says Supreme Court
content: The petition said that opaque airline practices, such as sudden fare escalations, reduced flight services, inadequate grievance redressal mechanisms, and algorithm-driven pricing, infringe upon citizens’ fundamental rights

title: TMC welcomes Supreme Court’s intervention on ‘logical discrepancies’ in West Bengal SIR
content: The Supreme Court order is a slap to those trying to take away the voting rights of the people of West Bengal, says TMC general secretary Abhishek Banerjee

title: Supreme Court flags ‘stress and strain’ caused by SIR to people of West Bengal, orders transparency
content: Over 1.3 crore people have been sent notices to produce documents/file objections on ‘logical discrepancies’ found against them; petitioners call it ‘heightened profiling’

title: Himachal Cabinet gives nod to levy ‘orphan and widow cess’ on petrol, high-speed diesel
content: The move was done with the aim of generating additional resources for strengthening welfare schemes benefiting orphans and widows

title: Woman killed, 12 injured as helium gas cylinder explodes in Kallakurichi
content: The incident occurred during the River Festival, which marks the end of the five-day Pongal festivities. The injured were admitted to the Tiruvannamalai Government Medical College and Hospital

title: Sonowal’s office denies fake letter claiming rift in Assam BJP, FIR lodged
content: Issuing a categorical clarification, the Minister’s office said the purported letter — claiming demands for a leadership change in Assam and making allegations against Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma — is completely fake

title: 18 detained for bid to stage protest at Manikarnika Ghat in Varanasi
content: The protesters alleged that a statue of Rani Ahilyabai Holkar had been damaged during ongoing redevelopment work

title: Tripura lawyers set three-day deadline to sack president of consumer commission
content: The president of the West Tripura District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, Gautam Sarkar, is accused of misbehaving with lawyers in an inebriated condition

title: ED attaches two luxury Gurugram flats worth about ₹73 crore in Gensol, BluSmart group cases
content: The ED probe is based on two First Information Reports registered by the Delhi Police Economic Offences Wing

title: Supreme Court agrees to consider interim bail plea of SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia in disproportionate assets case
content: Addressing concerns over his safety, the top court indicated that it could consider shifting Mr. Majithia to a prison in Chandigarh.

title: Election Commission to host international conference on election management, democracy
content: The ECI will hold over 40 bilateral meetings with EMBs; it will also launch ECINET, a digital platform for all election related information and services

title: SIT’s interim report shows need for exhaustive probe into Sabarimala temple administration for 20-odd years, says Kerala HC
content: The Division Bench, after examining the summary of the chemical analysis done by the VSSC, said that the apprehensions expressed by it earlier stood prima facie reinforced. SIT directed to submit a comprehensive probe status report by February 9, the day of hearing

title: Calcutta High Court takes suo motu cognisance of worsening AQI in Kolkata, issues notice to State
content: Last week, a PIL was also filed on the same matter, raising concerns about lack of action on rising air pollution in Kolkata.

title: RTC employees plan ‘Bengaluru Chalo’ protest on January 29 over pending arrears, wage revision
content: The JAC has submitted a formal representation to Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy, outlining their demands and expressing dissatisfaction over the lack of progress in talks with the government

title: Pilgrim footfall on Sabarimala Sathram route nearly doubled over last year
content: 2,02,806 pilgrims trekked the traditional forest path to Sannidhanam this season comapred to 1,32,528 pilgrims last year

title: HMT opposes Kerala govt’s move to acquire land for Judicial City project
content: The company maintained it did not obstruct earlier orders seeking its land in the larger public interest, but argued that the Judicial City project application was qualitatively different from previous ones

title: Revanth Reddy lands in Davos to promote Telangana as global investment hub
content: During the four-day conference Mr. Revanth Reddy is scheduled to hold extensive meetings with chief executive officers of global corporations, leading investors and representatives from diverse sectors

title: Kerala’s first ‘work near home’ facility inaugurated in Kottarakara
content: Govt.’s pioneering initiative, which aims to decentralise the IT sector, can be replicated across all regions of the State, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: State govt. will develop resting places of Rayanna's associates, says CM
content: Siddaramaiah was speaking after inaugurating Veer Bhoomi Sangolli Rayanna Museum in Nandagad of Khanapur taluk in Belagavi district

title: Elections to choose 13 APMC members to be held online on February 9
content: For the first time in the State, the elections for the council members will be held online, says Director of Secondary Health

title: Naidu at Davos announces ₹50-crore fund to boost entrepreneurship
content: CM highlights initiatives in A.P. aimed at fostering innovation and entrepreneurship, says government policy promotes the idea of ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur,’ wherein one spouse can focus on business while the other pursues employment

title: Lokesh outlines decentralised growth model with Amaravati as single capital
content: IT and HRD Minister says regional clusters, major investments and South Coast Railway Zone will drive Andhra Pradesh’s rapid development

title: Eight more Lakkundi structures will be declared as protected monument, says Minister
content: This is in addition to the 16 structures already declared as protected monument in Lakkundi village of Gadag district, according to H.K. Patil

title: Round-the-clock AI-enabled call centre on LSGD services
content: Services include resolution of various doubts regarding panchayat and municipality building regulations, panchayat license rules, and civil registration rules like birth, death, marriage.

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: 'Cultural shock': Madras HC on live-in relationships; what it said on women's status
content: madras high court expresses concern over live-in relationships 'happening everywhere' judge said women should be protected by granting the status of wife . in a live in relationship, women should also be provided with rights as a wife, he said .

title: Points league rankings: Young and Davis slide, Sabonis returns
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . the team announced this week that Young's knee and quadriceps injuries would keep him out for at least the next month, if not longer . this news dropped Young to the bottom of the top-60 in points league rankings .

title: 'Yellowcake': How false documents fuelled America's $1.7tn war in Iraq
content: Based on thorough analysis, the IAEA has concluded, with the concurrence of outside experts, that these documents, which formed the basis for the reports of recent uranium transactions between Iraq and Niger, are in fact not authentic. We have therefore concluded that these specific allegations are unfounded

title: The AFC North: 1 coach, 2 (?) starting QBs, many questions
content: new coach will have to cultivate a working relationship with lamar Jackson . owner Steve Bisciotti learned that Mike Tomlin had stepped down as the Pittsburgh Steelers ' head coach . this has become one of the most surprising offseasons in the AFC North because of the uncharacteristic turnover .

title: Why clamor for Man United, Tottenham 'DNA' makes no sense
content: football DNA is a term that seems to be used only when a manager/head coach is struggling and the supporters and former players boil their difficulties down tainted . the term is called football DNA . it is the first term that has been used to describe a football team's culture .

title: AL West update: Will M's spend more? Will Astros make a deal?
content: the biggest contract handed out in the American League West occurred on Nov. 17, a mere two weeks into the offseason . it wasn't from the Houston Astros, who claimed seven division titles and two world Series championships from 2017 to 2024 . the Seattle Mariners authored one of their greatest seasons in 2025 .

title: Nick Foles' message to Broncos fans: Pats 'struggle against backup QBs'
content: the Broncos will face the new England Patriots in next Sunday's AFC Championship game . backup quarterback Jarrett Stidham is out for the rest of the playoffs . he hasn't started a game since the final two of the 2023 season .

title: Will Heisman-winning QB Fernando Mendoza fall victim to the national title curse?
content: the 2025 Heisman Trophy is awarded to the players regarded as the best in all of college football . this year's winner helped carry his team to the national championship game . the only major college program to achieve the feat was Yale ... in 1894 .

title: NHL trade grades: Who comes out ahead on the Kiefer Sherwood swap?
content: the Calgary Flames traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud . Previously, the Vancouver Canucks traded Quinn Hughes to the Minnesota Wild in exchange for Zeev Buium , Marco Rossi , Liam Ohgren and a 2026 first-round pick . the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers .

title: Iowa women crack top 10 for 1st time post-Clark
content: the Huskies have won 34 consecutive games dating back to last season . the first-place votes in parentheses are no. 2 south Carolina and no. 3 UCLA . each team climbed one placard despite losing to south Carolina last week .

title: Patriots hold off Texans in turnover-filled divisional round playoff game
content: the new England Patriots beat texans 28-16 in a divisional round playoff game . the Patriots' defense forced five turnovers, intercepting Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud four times . new England quarterback Drake Maye overcame three turnovers to help the no. 2 seed advance .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top six teams remain the same . just two of the Huskies' 13 remaining regular-season opponents are ranked: Notre Dame and Tennessee .

title: Coaching candidates on Bills' radar, and Josh Allen's influence: Answering key questions
content: Sean McDermott's tenure as the Buffalo Bills ' head coach ended Monday . the bills had the second-most wins (98-50) of any franchise since 2017 . general manager Brandon Beane has been promoted to president of football operations .

title: Mario Cristobal didn't come to Miami to take things easy
content: coach Mario Cristobal sat in his office a few days after a humiliating loss to Florida State . the walls around him were still sparse because who has time to decorate when so much else needs to be done? he says he feels the obligation to get Miami right .
